choices.name: Get started with research for your Hawaii ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Hawaii ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Hawaii research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Hawaii research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Hawaii Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Hawaii research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Hawaii Overview—3:38

  3. Follow this research study for Hawaii ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Hawaii Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Hawaii research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Hawaii Resources
    ☆ AC—Hawaii State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

  5. African American: Explore the African American Gateway for Hawaii.
Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

1. Explore Hawaii historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Hawaii History

  2. Explore Hawaii history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Hawaii

  3. Learn about Hawaii history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Hawaii History

choices.name: Learn about Hawaii archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Hawaii archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Hawaii Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Hawaii State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about the resources available at the Hawaii State Library.

    ☆ FS—Spotlight on the Hawai’i State Library

  3. Explore the Hawaii state archives.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Hawaii.
  5. Explore the Hawaii Dept of Archives site.
  6. Explore the Hawaiian Electronic Library site. You can click the link in the upper right of the webpage to switch between Hawaiian and English.
  7. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Hawaii genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  8. Search for ☆free online books on Hawaii research on the FamilySearch site.
  9. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Hawaii ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Hawaii city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Hawaii Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Hawaii city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Hawaii city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Hawaii ☆historical directories by county.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Hawaii County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Hawaii.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Hawaii Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Hawaii Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Hawaii Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Hawaii Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the Native Hawaiian Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Hawaii.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Hawaii research.
  2. Explore the Hawaii research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Hawaii research.

choices.name: Learn about Hawaii genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Hawaii in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Hawaii Societies

  2. Explore the Hawaiian Historical Society and Library site.
  3. Explore the Honolulu County Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore Hawaii genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Hawaii.
